trans-unit.source: Provides a file system implementation of the <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> class implements the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse>`abstract` base class to return file system resources for the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> class.

Client applications do not create <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> instances directly; instead, they are created by calling the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method on a <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> instance.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method returns a <xref:System.IO.Stream> instance that provides read-only access to a file system resource.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> class relies on the <xref:System.IO.File> class for error handling and code access security.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse"></xref> class from the specified instances of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> classes.
This constructor implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface for the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> class.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> instance that contains the information required to serialize the new <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse"></xref> instance.

An instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> class that contains the source of the serialized stream associated with the new <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse"></xref> instance.
Closes the response stream.

The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Close%2A> method cleans up the resources used by a <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> and closes the response stream by calling the <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The response stream must be closed to avoid running out of system resources.
You can closes the response stream by calling either <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Close%2A>
Gets the length of the content in the file system resource.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentLength%2A> property contains the length, in bytes, of the file system resource.
The number of bytes returned from the file system resource.
Gets the content type of the file system resource.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentType%2A> property contains the content type of the file system resource.
The value of <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentType%2A> is always "binary/octet-stream".
The value "binary/octet-stream".
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> with the data needed to serialize the target object.
Any objects included in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> are automatically tracked and serialized by the formatter.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to populate with data.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that specifies the destination for this serialization.
Returns the data stream from the file system resource.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method returns the data stream from the file system resource.
The response stream must be closed to avoid running out of system resources.
The response stream can be closed by calling <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Close%2A>
A <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> for reading data from the file system resource.
Gets a collection of header name/value pairs associated with the response.

The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.Headers%2A> property contains two name/value pairs, one for content length and one for content type, both of which are also exposed as properties, <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentLength%2A> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ContentType%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Net.WebHeaderCollection"></xref> that contains the header name/value pairs associated with the response.
Gets the URI of the file system resource that provided the response.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.ResponseUri%2A> property contains the URI of the file system resource that provided the response.
This is always the file system resource that was requested.
A <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contains the URI of the file system resource that provided the response.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse.Headers"></xref> property is supported by the <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse"></xref> instance.
This property is always true for [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)].
Returns <xref href="System.Boolean"></xref>.
true if the <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse.Headers"></xref> property is supported by the <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse"></xref> instance; otherwise, false.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> instance with the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> , which will hold the serialized data for the <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> containing the destination of the serialized stream associated with the new <xref href="System.Net.FileWebResponse"></xref>.
